title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1936/84 of 4 July 1984 on the classification of goods falling within subheading 85.21 D II of the Common Customs Tariff
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1936/84
of 4 July 1984
on the classification of goods falling within subheading 85.21 D II of the Common Customs Tariff
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
A microcomputer of 15 × 51 ×2 mm with 40 correcting pins and equipped with inter alia:
- a user-programmable ultraviolet erasable 1 K × 8 bit program memory (EPROM),
- a 64 × 8 bit read/write data memory (RAM),
- 27 in/out lines,
- an 8 bit timer/counter, and
- an on-board oscillator and clock circuit
shall be classified in the Common Customs Tariff under heading No:
85.21 Thermionic, cold cathode and photo-cathode valves and tubes (including vapour or gas-filled valves and tubes, cathode-ray tubes, television camera tubes and mercury arc rectifying valves and tubes); photocells; mounted piezo-electric crystals; diodes, transistors and similar semiconductor devices; light-emitting diodes; electronic microcircuits:
D. Diodes, transistors and similar semi-conductor devices; light-emitting diodes; electronic mircocircuits:
II. Other.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the 21st day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 4 July 1984.
For the Commission
Karl-Heinz NARJES
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 14, 21. 1. 1969, p. 1.
(2) OJ No L 172, 22. 7. 1968, p. 1.
(3) OJ No L 107, 19. 4. 1984, p. 1.
